intro: Gomidesia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy gomidesia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
